column1: #Text=is a land-locked country located in Southern Africa and bordering on Namibia , South Africa , Zimbabwe and Zambia .
#Text=Formerly the British protectorate of Bechuanaland , Botswana adopted its new name upon independence in 1966 .
#Text=Its economy , one of the most robust on the continent , is dominated by diamond mining and tourism .

#Text=Botswana is famous for its wildlife , and areas like Chobe National Park , Moremi Game Reserve in the Okavango Delta , and the Central Kalahari Game Reserve have a very high concentration of game .
#Text=The bulk of the Kalahari desert falls within Botswana 's borders and Botswana is home to most of the world 's San ( Bushman ) population .
#Text=or Gabs – a neat and tidy little capital , but with rapidly growing shantytowns on its periphery
#Text=- A unique geological formation where a delta is formed by a river ( the Okavango ) flowing into the Kalahari desert instead of the ocean .
#Text=Part of the Delta is designated as Moremi Game Reserve
#Text=- a great place to see wildlife , and a good point from which to move on to Victoria Falls .
#Text=- a unique corner of Africa where nature & culture combine in spectacular wildlife , stunning scenery and fascinating history
#Text=Instead , the Three Chiefs went to the Queen of England to ask for protection from Boers to the south and Ndebele tribes from the north-east .
#Text=The Boers were ( to them ) the white people that had invaded and were taking over South Africa .
#Text=In 1964 the Three Chiefs went back to England and told the Queen that they did not need the protection any more .
#Text=The Queen did away with the protection , and the Chiefs went back to Botswana .
#Text=They produce 65 % of the world diamonds today .
#Text=In 1969 DeBeers created a partnership with the Botswana government to create the company Debswana .

#Text=Botswana has been a stable representative democracy since independence and has been largely devoid of the racial and ethnic conflict some of its neighbours have suffered from — perhaps due in part to the relative dominance of its majority Tswana ethnic group .
#Text=Since the turn of the century , thousands of Zimbabweans have sought sanctuary and economic betterment .

#Text=One of the poorest countries at independence , Botswana transformed itself into one of the fastest-growing economies in the world with a GDP ( purchasing power parity ) per capita of about USD14,000 per annum .

#Text=In contrast to the sad situation of its eastern neighbour , Zimbabwe , kleptocracy has been absent and Botswana now also has the second highest Human Development Index of all continental Sub-Saharan African countries .
#Text=( " Good Friday " , " Easter Saturday " , " Easter Sunday " and " Easter Monday " ) : a four day long weekend in March or April set according to the Western Christian dates .
#Text=The first Monday after Christmas is also a Public Holiday .
#Text=The Tswana , for whom Botswana is named , comprise 79 % of the population .
#Text=Unlike more stiff necked administrations such as India , Pakistan , Nigeria and China , the Botswana government has not erected high bureaucratic barriers to enrichment from tourism .
#Text=Citizens of Commonwealth countries do not need a visa to visit except those from Bangladesh , Cameroon , Ghana , India , Nigeria , Pakistan , and Sri Lanka .
#Text=Citizens of European Union countries , Norway , Iceland , Liechtenstein and Switzerland do not require a visa to visit .

#Text=Citizens of Argentina , Angola , Bahrain , Brazil , Chile , Costa Rica , Cuba , Dominican Republic , Israel , Japan , Kuwait , Mexico , Oman , Paraguay , Peru , Qatar , Russia , Saudi Arabia , South Korea , South Sudan , Turkey , United Arab Emirates , United States of America , Uruguay , Venezuela , Zimbabwe do not require a visa to visit .
#Text=For citizens of other nations , a visa must be obtained prior to arrival and this usually takes about a week to process .

#Text=Visas can be applied for at a Botswana embassy in Australia , Belgium , Brazil , China , Ethiopia , India , Japan , Kenya , Namibia , Nigeria , South Africa , Sweden , Switzerland , the United Kingdom , Zambia , Zimbabwe and at the United Nations in New York , USA .

#Text=If you require a visa to enter Botswana , you might be able to apply for one at a British embassy , high commission or consulate in the country where you legally reside if there is no Botswana diplomatic post .
#Text=The UK Government website lists UK embassies around the world where Commonwealth visas can be issued .
#Text=British diplomatic posts charge £50 to process a Botswana visa application and an extra £70 if the authorities in Botswana require the visa application to be referred to them .
#Text=The authorities in Botswana can also decide to charge an additional fee if they correspond with you directly .
#Text=Botswana 's main airport is Sir Seretse Khama in Gaborone .
#Text=International flights are to Zimbabwe , South Africa , Namibia , Kenya and Ethiopia .
#Text=The airport in Maun can also be reached via Johannesburg , Cape Town , or Gaborone and , once a day ( in summer 2009 ) , from Windhoek , Namibia .
#Text=The distance between Gaborone and Maun is more than 1,000 km .
#Text=Maun is very much a tourist attraction spot .
#Text=Harare , Victoria Falls , Lusaka , Johannesburg , Cape Town .
#Text=via Addis Ababa . to Europe , Asia , Africa .
#Text=Trains to/from South Africa have been withdrawn since 1999 .
